channel.title: llm on Dwarves Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in llm on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: Create slides with Overleaf and ChatGPT
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: My workflow with Overleaf and ChatGPT A few weeks ago, I was asked to make a slide deck for a team meeting.

item.title: Building MVP for AI-driven interview platform
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Our engineering team collaborated with a confidential HRTech client to create an MVP for AI-based, real-time voice interviews. Built in just two weeks to validate the concept, the solution leverages advanced AI and AI voice processing to conduct sales-specific interviews.

item.title: Intro to Model Context Protocol
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: By making a new protocol known as the Model Context Protocol (MCP) open-source, Anthropic made a major change in AI. By overcoming the limitations of traditional data integration techniques and addressing the recurrent problem of data isolation, this protocol aims to enhance the connections between data hubs and AI systems.

item.title: Quantization for large language models
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: As large language models (LLMs) continue to evolve, their parameter counts grow exponentially, with some models reaching trillions of parameters. This exponential growth presents significant challenges for deployment on edge devices and in resource-constrained environments due to extensive memory and computational requirements.

item.title: AI digest #2 New command Aider, OpenHands, Qwen2.5 Coder 32B, Predicted Output
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Aider v0.63.0 release Support for Qwen 2.5 Coder 32B. /web command just adds the page to the chat, without triggering an LLM response.

item.title: Natural Language to Database Queries: Text-to-MongoDB
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: graph TD A[Natural Language Interface] --> B{Data Access} B --> C[Non-Technical Users] B --> D[Data Scientists] B --> E[Business Analysts] A --> F{Analytics} F --> G[Real-Time Insights] F --> H[Interactive Exploration] F --> I[Agentic Workflows] A --> J{Data Integration} J --> K[Cross-Database Queries] J --> L[Cross-Domain Analysis] There are a lot of external efforts in creating text2sql LLMs and workflows to facilitate in Retrieval Augmented Generation and agentic workflows.

item.title: Market report October 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Key takeaways AI chat evolves: Chat interfaces advance, potentially leading to a unified tool for diverse tasks, such as browser and OS integration.

item.title: GraphRAG - Building a knowledge graph for RAG system
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: In baseline Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), sometimes the result might not be accurate as expected since the query itself have multiple layers of reasoning or the answer requires traversing disparate pieces of information through their shared attributes in order to provide new synthesized insights.

item.title: Salesforce use cases
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Salesforce agentforce platform Salesforce’s Einstein GPT is a key component of their AI-driven capabilities. It serves as a user interface that connects Salesforce’s core offerings (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, etc.

item.title: AI digest #1 Aider reasoning, OpenAI Realtime API, Cline - pre Claude-dev
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: This week’s AI updates are all about making life easier for developers working with agentic tools. Cline, formerly known as Claude Dev, just dropped its v2.

item.title: Build your knowledge base
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: In an age where Large Language Models like ChatGPT offer instant access to a universe of information, it raises the question: does our own personal knowledge base still hold any value, and is building a personal knowledge base still a legitimate thing to do?

item.title: Guardrails in llm
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Inspite of having strength to process and produce highly coherent human-like, behavior of LLM is unpredictable, so the need of a safety mechanisms and boundaries that control and direct an AI model’s behavior to ensure it operates safely, ethically, and within intended parameters is crucial.

item.title: ReAct(Reason + Act) in LLM
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Working with Large Language Models (LLMs) may seem straightforward at first glance. Initially, we might think that simply prompting the AI model with a task is sufficient for it to assist us.

item.title: ReWOO: Reasoning without observation - A deeper look
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: In the process of improving Large Language Model (LLM) performance, many techniques have been proposed. The Augmented Language Model (ALM) approach boosted LLM accuracy by enabling the attachment of external sources to enhance the model’s knowledge.

item.title: Yelp use cases
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Yelp Inc. is a platform that helps users discover local businesses through reviews, ratings, and recommendations. Recently, they’ve integrated AI and large language models (LLMs) to improve content moderation, search capabilities, and user interactions with features like Yelp Assistant.

item.title: Model selection
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Choosing the right model isn’t about finding a one-size-fits-all solution; it’s about understanding what works best for your specific needs. Each model comes with its own set of strengths and trade-offs, so the key is identifying what truly matters for your application.

item.title: Logging
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: When you’re working with generative AI application, one thing that often gets overlooked is logging. Logging helps you keep track of what’s happening under the hood and gives you the insights you need to improve your model.

item.title: Metrics
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: When it comes to observability in Large Language Model (LLM) applications, metrics have significance delivering that these systems work correctly. Metrics provide information on both system performance and model efficiency, enabling developers and researchers to fine-tune their systems.

item.title: Observability in AI platforms
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Introduction Importance of observability Observability in AI systems, especially LLMs, is about understanding what’s happening behind the scenes. It’s essential for ensuring smooth operations, building user trust, and meeting compliance standards by monitoring performance, spotting issues, and staying accountable.

item.title: Tracing
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: What is tracing Tracing is a way to keep track of, debug, and get a clear picture of how an LLM app is running.

item.title: Intent classification by LLM
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: User intent classification is a crucial aspect of conversational AI, start with machine learning models, but now advanced language models (LLMs) are being explored for this task.

item.title: Market report September 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Key takeaways In the latest models from OpenAI (o1-preview and o1-mini) introduce new trade-offs between cost and performance, and their effectiveness is still being questioned.

item.title: LLM as a judge
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: With the robust growth of LLM models currently, there is a new method used to evaluate the performance of large language models (LLMs): LLM-as-a-Judge, also known as LLM-evaluators.

item.title: Use cases for LLM applications
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The potential applications of large language models (LLMs) and other AI foundation models seem truly endless. If you can dream it up, chances are there’s an AI system out there that can help bring your vision to life.

item.title: The rise of AI applications with LLM
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: In the course of technological history, few developments have captured the imagination and transformed industries as swiftly and profoundly as the recent surge in artificial intelligence.

item.title: Go Commentary #13: Compiler Quests and Vector Vexations
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Register Allocation in the Go Compiler Red Hat has graced us with a deep dive into Go’s register allocation in the compiler.

item.title: Evaluation guidelines for LLM applications
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Overview Evaluation is a hard part of building an RAG system, especially for application-integrated LLM solving your business problem. This guide outlines a clear, step-by-step approach to effectively evaluating and optimizing the integration of a third-party Large Language Model (LLM) into your application.

item.title: Prevent prompt injection
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Nowadays, Large Language Models (LLMs) have become integral to various applications. However, with great power comes great responsibility, and the rise of LLMs has introduced new security challenges.

item.title: Go Commentary #12: CLI Renaissance with Kubernetes, REST, and Terminal Readers in the Age of Complexity
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: kl: An interactive Kubernetes log viewer for your terminal An interactive Kubernetes log viewer for your terminal. // Example usage of kl kl --context my-context,other-context -n default,other-ns This tool allows you to view logs across multiple containers, pods, and even clusters.

item.title: Evaluate Chatbot Agent by User Simulation
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: When building a chatbot agent, it’s important to evaluate its performance and user satisfaction. One effective method is user simulation, which involves creating virtual users to interact with the chatbot and assess its responses.

item.title: § Building LLM system
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: In recent years, the emergence of large language models (LLMs) has revolutionized AI applications, providing new opportunities for solving complex problems with natural language understanding and generation.

item.title: Journey of Thought Prompting: Harnessing AI to Craft Better Prompts
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The Problem with Prompt Engineering Let’s face it: prompt engineering is hard. We’re all fumbling in the dark, trying to coax these large language models into doing what we want.

item.title: LLM tracing in AI system
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: When Building software with Large Language Models (LLMs) involves several steps, from planning to deployment. LLM tracing emerges as a final step in this process, providing ongoing insights and enabling continuous improvement of LLM-powered applications.

item.title: Multi-agent collaboration for task completion
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: In AI integrated systems, instead of putting all the workload on a single agent, we can apply a divide and conquer strategy to distribute workload to multiple agents.

item.description: Key takeaways Tools like Cursor and Claude 3.5 Sonnet are redefining programming by shifting focus from manual coding to guiding AI-generated code, signaling a move toward AI-driven development.

item.title: Evaluating caching in RAG systems
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Introduction In the rapidly evolving landscape of artificial intelligence, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems have emerged as a powerful paradigm for combining the strengths of retrieval-based and generative models.

item.title: Evaluating search engine in RAG systems
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Introduction Retrieval-Augmented Generation is challenging the world of traditional search engines and LLM information retrieval. Hybrid search, which combines the strengths of vector search and full-text search, offers a powerful solution for the lack of precision in vector search and meaning in full-text search.

item.title: What is Generative UI?
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: What is Generative UI? A generative UI (genUI) is a user interface that responds to the user with AI-generated elements instead of just text messages.

item.description: Collecting user feedback is importance for improving the accuracy and relevance of responses. One simple yet powerful feedback mechanism is the thumbs up and thumbs down system.

item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Getting consistent and accurate answers from LLMs is a major challenge. One effective strategy to address this challenge is incorporating a robust feedback mechanism within the app to collect user feedback.

item.description: Introduction Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) is an algorithm that aims to improve the stability of training by avoiding overly large policy updates.

item.description: Gradient descent is a fundamental optimization algorithm in machine learning. It’s a bit like finding your way down a mountain in the fog: you take small steps in the direction that seems to be going downhill the fastest.

item.title: RLHF with Open Assistant

item.description: What is Open Assistant? Open Assistant (abbreviated as OA) is a chat-based and open-source assistant. The vision of the project is to make a large language model that can run on a single high-end consumer GPU.

item.description: Adversarial prompting is a crucial aspect of prompt engineering, as it aids in understanding the risks and safety concerns associated with Large Language Models (LLMs).

item.title: Chunking strategies to overcome context limitation in LLM
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: When it comes to Large Language Models (LLMs) like GPT, managing context size - the number of tokens per prompt - is a unique challenge.

item.title: LLM's Accuracy - Self Refinement
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Self-refinement is a technique where the model evaluates and refines its own output. Normally, when using an LLM, you provide a prompt and the model generates a completion.

item.title: Query Caching for Large Language Models
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: It’s quite fascinating to see the increasingly pivotal role that Large Language Models (LLMs) are playing in various applications, covering the spectrum from natural language processing tasks to predictive typing, and more.

item.title: Introduction to Reinforcement Learning and Its Application with LLMs
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Introduction Reinforcement Learning (RL) is a machine learning method in which an automated system, known as an agent, interacts with a dynamic environment to learn and improve its action strategy.

item.title: How We Created An Ai Powered Interview System Using Openais Chatgpt
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The Idea While ChatGPT has garnered a lot of attention over the last few months, Ngoc Thanh, our senior software engineer, has been exploring how OpenAI’s API can expedite and elevate job interviews by distilling key candidate insights through an interactive chat interview.

item.title: Easy Prompt Engineering For Business Use And Mitigating Risks In Llms
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Preface At Dwarves, we’ve begun creating apps with ChatGPT for some of our clients. One common problem we face is what techniques of prompt engineering should we use for cases like avoiding political interactions and defending against data leaks.

item.title: Foundation Models: The Latest Advancement in AI
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Foundation models are the latest advancement in the AI realm, proposed by Stanford researchers. Unlike conventional AI systems, they aren’t limited to specific tasks, making them a game-changer for a variety of applications.

item.title: Select Vector Database for LLM
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: During our research on applying LLM to real-world applications, we have observed the widespread usage and increasing popularity of Vector databases in various fields.

item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: At Dwarves, we’ve been increasingly exposed to more state-of-the-art news coming from AI than ever before, of course, related to Large Language Models (LLM).

item.title: Build your chatbot with open source Large Language Models
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Currently, AI chatbot services like ChatGPT are being widely used, but these services are restricted in many countries and also prohibited by many schools due to the high quality of results they produce compared to the level of students’ knowledge.

item.title: Workaround with OpenAI's token limit with Langchain
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Problem Tuning OpenAI’s ChatGPT comes as a very finicky problem as we don’t have access to the model and other forms of tuning GPT are very limited.

item.title: Working with langchain document loaders
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Langchain is a framework that enables the development of applications that utilize language models. It provides support for various main modules, including Models, Prompts, Memory, Indexes, Chains, and Agents.

item.title: Forward Engineering December 2023
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: This month, we have focused on revamping how we learn, familiarize, and work with tech. We are excited to announce that we have updated our Forward Engineering to better reflect the feedback and insights from our Labs team, Operations Team, and Consulting Team.
